law.catch_line: Court order upon failure to obey cabinet subpoena.
law.text: In case of refusal to obey a subpoena issued to any person, any Circuit Court of competent jurisdiction, upon application by any party, may issue to that person an order requiring him to appear before the cabinet, there to produce documentary evidence if so ordered or to give evidence touching the matter under investigation or in question; and any failure to obey the order of the court may be punished by the court as a contempt of court.
law.history: Amended 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 192, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1982. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 355, sec. 11, effective June 21, 1974.
